Uses of Class
com.stormpath.sdk.resource.ResourceException

  • Packages that use ResourceException 
    Package Description
    com.stormpath.sdk.application  
    com.stormpath.sdk.error.authc  
    com.stormpath.sdk.tenant  

    • Uses of ResourceException in com.stormpath.sdk.application

      Methods in com.stormpath.sdk.application that throw ResourceException 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      AccountStoreMapping Application.addAccountStore(AccountStore accountStore)
      Creates a new AccountStoreMapping for this Application and appends that AccountStoreMapping to the end of the Application's AccountStoreMapping list, allowing the associated accountStore to be used as a source of accounts that may login to the Application.
      AuthenticationResult Application.authenticateAccount(AuthenticationRequest request)
      Authenticates an account's submitted principals and credentials (e.g.
      ApiAuthenticationResult Application.authenticateApiRequest(Object httpRequest)
      Authenticates an HTTP request submitted to your application's API, returning a result that reflects the successfully authenticated Account that made the request and the ApiKey used to authenticate the request.
      Account Application.createAccount(Account account)
      Creates a new Account that may login to this application.
      Account Application.createAccount(CreateAccountRequest request)
      Creates a new Account that may login to this application according to the request criteria.
      AccountStoreMapping Application.createAccountStoreMapping(AccountStoreMapping mapping)
      Creates a new AccountStoreMapping for this Application, allowing the associated accountStore to be used as a source of accounts that may login to the Application.
      Group Application.createGroup(Group group)
      Creates a new Group that may be used by this application in the application's defaultGroupStore

      This is a convenience method.
      ApiKey Application.getApiKey(String id)
      Gets an ApiKey, by its id, that belongs to an Account that has access to this application by a mapped account store.
      ApiKey Application.getApiKey(String id, ApiKeyOptions options)
      Gets an ApiKey, by its id, that belongs to an Account that has access to this application by a mapped account store.

    • Uses of ResourceException in com.stormpath.sdk.error.authc

      Subclasses of ResourceException in com.stormpath.sdk.error.authc 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AccessTokenOauthException
      A sub-class of ResourceException representing an attempt to login via Oauth using an invalid accessToken.
      class  DisabledAccountException
      A sub-class of ResourceException representing an attempt to login to a disabled or unverified Account.
      class  DisabledApiKeyException
      A sub-class of ResourceException thrown when the ApiKey used is disabled.
      class  IncorrectCredentialsException
      A sub-class of ResourceException representing an attempt to login using incorrect credentials.
      class  InvalidApiKeyException
      A sub-class of ResourceException representing an attempt to login using an malformed credentials.
      class  InvalidAuthenticationException
      Thrown when the Authentication credentials (or access_token for Oauth requests) cannot be found in the httpRequest.
      class  MissingApiKeyException
      Thrown when the an Authentication Request lacks an ApiKey.
      class  OauthAuthenticationException
      A sub-class of ResourceException representing an attempt fail an oauth authentication.
      class  UnsupportedAuthenticationSchemeException
      A sub-class of ResourceException representing an authentication scheme not supported by Stormpath.

    • Uses of ResourceException in com.stormpath.sdk.tenant

      Methods in com.stormpath.sdk.tenant that throw ResourceException 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Application TenantActions.createApplication(Application application)
      Creates a new Application resource in the current tenant.
      Application TenantActions.createApplication(CreateApplicationRequest request)
      Creates a new Application resource in the current tenant based on the specified CreateApplicationRequest.
      Directory TenantActions.createDirectory(CreateDirectoryRequest createDirectoryRequest)
      Creates a new Provider-based Directory resource in the current tenant based on the specified CreateDirectoryRequest.
